question: The "Helsinki-Tallinn Tunnel" is a proposed rail undersea tunnel connecting which two countries?
explanation: The Helsinki-Tallinn Tunnel is a proposed rail undersea tunnel connecting Finland and Estonia that would span the Gulf of Finland and connect Helsinki, the capital city of Finland, and Tallinn, the capital city of Estonia. If completed it will be the longest undersea tunnel in the world. The construction of this project is proposed to be completed by 2030.
